intro: Quartinia, commonly known as the Quartinia tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Bolivia and Peru. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. Quartinia species are often found in high-altitude forests and are adapted to cool, moist climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
